result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*NO contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

*NO contact with victim Veronica C. unless approved by court or agent.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.

*Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and A course in anger management.
*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending review hearing. Probation review hearing scheduled for 12/11/15 at 1:30pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez

Signed and filed on 3-11-16:  Decision and Order Denying Motion to Allow Visits with Children.

Defendant's motion to allow visits wth his children, received in 15CM000561, 15CM000743 and 15CM001331.
Bail Refund Check Packet
8/20/15 Bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety/defendant.

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Ruth Garcia. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 26 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and A course in anger management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Veronica C. unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Sworn as interpreter:  Ruth Garcia.   mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Ruth Garcia.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1 and #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-13-2015 at 8:15 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Veronica C. or children, no possession of firearms or dangerous weapons and cooperate with Justice Point Supervision.   mld
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.   mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter Enrique Barbosa.
Court consented to Attorney Rick Steinberg be substituted as counsel for Attorney Ed Borda on case 2015CM1331.  Defense counsel is in receipt of all the discovery for the (3) three cases.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-17-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Veronica C., until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter waived by defense counsel for the purposes of these proceedings.
The defendant currently has two other cases (2015CM561 and 2015CM743), pending for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  Attorney Rick Steinberg is the assigned counsel of record on the two other cases for defendant.  Case 2015CM1331 adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 8:30 am., to determine if Attorney Steinberg will be assigned to the new case.  On the next date, the Court would allow Attorney Borda to withdraw as counsel on case 2015CM1331, or submit a signed stipulation for change of counsel.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Veronica C. or her children, no guns, cooperate with Justice Point Supervision and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   md
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez not in court, defendant in custody.  Attorney Eduardo Borda office via telephone. Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eduardo Borda just appointed on 4/21/15 and was unable to appear this date.  Attempted to schedule a new date for next week, however, date given would not accomodiate Attorney Borda's calendar.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Veronica C. or her children.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
